citation.article-title: Spiroplasma taiwanense sp. nov. from Culex tritaeniorhynchus mosquitoes collected in Taiwan.

p.s: Description of Spiroplasma taiwanense sp. nov.
Spiroplasma taiwanense (tai.wan.en'se. L. neut. adj. taiwanensis of Taiwan, referring to the geographic origin of the isolate)
Helical filaments 100 to 160 nm in diameter and 3.1 to 3.8 μm long.
The cells lack true cell walls and periplasmic fibrils.
Colonies on solid M1D medium containing 1.6% Noble agar frequently have a fried-egg morphology.
Does not hydrolyze arginine and urea.
Agar colonies do not hemadsorb guinea pig erythrocytes.
Isolated from female mosquitoes, Culex tritaeniorhynchus, at Taishan, Republic of China.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the deoxyribonucleic acid is 25 ± 1 mol%.
Serologically distinct from the type and representative strains of groups I through XXI and XXIII.
The type strain is strain CT-1 (= ATCC 43302).
